level.heading: Defense to sexual abuse.
level.text: Consent by the victim is a defense to a prosecution under §§ 22-3002 to 22-3006, prosecuted alone or in conjunction with charges under § 22-3018 or §§ 22-401 and 22-403.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 18-88 deleted "defense, which the defendant must establish by a preponderance of the evidence," following "defense".

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 213 of Omnibus Public Safety and Justice Emergency Amendment Act of 2009 (D.C. Act 18-181, August 6, 2009, 56 DCR 6903).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 213 of Omnibus Public Safety and Justice Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2009 (D.C. Act 18-227, October 21, 2009, 56 DCR 8668).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 10-257
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 10-257, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 22-3001.
